Sounds like a Parameterized TestCase ( or a variant thereof ). It has been described in a number of different places, but the best discussion I've seen is in JB Rainsberger's JUnit Recipes (Manning, 2005) in Recipe 4.8, and code in Appendix A.2
George

----- Original Message -----
From: "Selvaraj, Lourduraj (TCS, EB&T)" <lourduraj.selvaraj@...>
Date: Monday, July 24, 2006 12:01 pm
Subject: [junit] Junit reporting

> Hi All,
>     I am using JUnit for regression testing. One of my test case 
> methods executes same testconditions with a list of input data. 
> When one of my test case condition fails, JUnit reports failure 
> and aborts from further executing the other test data.
> 
> 	While it reports the failure, I would love it to execute the 
> other tests also in the test method and report their results. Is 
> there a way to make JUnit it to report alone and ignore the 
> failures to continue testing.
> 
>       Please find the sample code.
> 
>   public void testMyStuff(){
> 	String expectedResult[] = getExpectedResult();
> 	String actualResult[] = getActualResult();
> 	for(int i=0;i<expectedResult.length;i++){
>        	assertEquals("Case 
> failed"+i,expectedResult[i],actualResult[i] );
> 	}
>   }
> 
> 
> 	Any help is greatly appreciated.
> 
> Thanks,
> Raj
> 
>
